<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
I see the issue now. The code is using `react-syntax-highlighter` with the `vscDarkPlus` theme. This theme has its own styling that applies colors. The issue is that:

1. The `vscDarkPlus` theme might be setting some text to darker colors for markdown content
2. There's also code blocks without a language specified (line 40-44) that don't get syntax highlighting

Looking at the screenshot, the issue is that markdown formatting (like `**bold**` text showing as `**text**`) is visible, which suggests this might be raw markdown being rendered in code blocks without proper syntax highlighting.

The issue is that when there's no detected language or when it's inline code, it falls back to a plain `<code>` element. Also, code blocks without a language don't get the SyntaxHighlighter treatment.

Let me fix this by:
1. Making non-language code blocks also use the dark theme
2. Ensuring all code content is white/light colored

Let me update the ConversationBlock to handle code blocks without language specification better, and also update the CSS to ensure proper theming.</details></think>

Done! I've made a more comprehensive fix:

**ConversationBlock.jsx changes:**
- All block code now goes through `SyntaxHighlighter` (not just code with a language specified)
- Uses `'text'` as fallback language for unspecified code blocks

- Added `pre` tag handler to prevent double-wrapping issues

- More targeted selectors for code block styling
- Explicit light text color (`#d4d4d4`) for base text, code elements, and plain text tokens
- Ensures all code content is readable against the dark background

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is asking if the code syntax highlighting is using CodeMirror. Let me check what's being used - from the code I've been working with, it's using `react-syntax-highlighter` with Prism, not CodeMirror.</details></think>

---

No, it's using **react-syntax-highlighter** with **Prism** as the underlying syntax highlighter, not CodeMirror.

From `ConversationBlock.jsx`:

```javascript
import { Prism as SyntaxHighlighter } from 'react-syntax-highlighter';
```

CodeMirror is a full code editor component (with editing capabilities), while Prism is just a syntax highlighting library for display purposes. For a read-only log viewer like this, Prism is the right choice - it's lighter weight and designed specifically for presenting code with syntax highlighting.

**Chunk 2**

```diff
@@ -78,4 +83,84 @@
    });
  };
+ 
+ /**
+  * Parses SpecStory export format
+  * Format: _**User (timestamp)**_ or _**Agent (model info)**_
+  */
+ const parseSpecStoryFormat = (markdown) =&gt; {
+   const sections = [];
+   
+   // Split on --- separators
+   const parts = markdown.split(/\n---\n/);
+   
+   let currentSection = null;
+   
+   for (const part of parts) {
+     const trimmed = part.trim();
+     
+     // Skip empty parts
+     if (!trimmed) continue;
+     
+     // Check for User marker: _**User (timestamp)**_
+     const userMatch = trimmed.match(/^_\*\*User\s*\([^)]*\)\*\*_/);
+     if (userMatch) {
+       if (currentSection) sections.push(currentSection);
+       const content = trimmed.replace(/^_\*\*User\s*\([^)]*\)\*\*_\n*/, &#39;&#39;);
+       currentSection = {
+         id: sections.length,
+         type: &#39;user&#39;,
+         content: content,
+       };
+       continue;
+     }
+     
+     // Check for Agent marker: _**Agent (model info)**_
+     const agentMatch = trimmed.match(/^_\*\*Agent\s*\([^)]*\)\*\*_/);
+     if (agentMatch) {
+       if (currentSection) sections.push(currentSection);
+       const content = trimmed.replace(/^_\*\*Agent\s*\([^)]*\)\*\*_\n*/, &#39;&#39;);
+       currentSection = {
+         id: sections.length,
+         type: &#39;cursor&#39;,
+         content: content,
+       };
+       continue;
+     }
+     
+     // Check for think blocks - append to current cursor section
+     if (trimmed.startsWith(&#39;&lt;think&gt;&#39;) &amp;&amp; currentSection?.type === &#39;cursor&#39;) {
+       // Extract thought content and add to current section
+       const thinkContent = trimmed.replace(/&lt;think&gt;|&lt;\/think&gt;/g, &#39;&#39;);
+       currentSection.content += &#39;\n\n&#39; + thinkContent;
+       continue;
+     }
+     
+     // Check for tool-use blocks - append to current cursor section
+     if (trimmed.startsWith(&#39;&lt;tool-use&#39;) &amp;&amp; currentSection?.type === &#39;cursor&#39;) {
+       // Skip tool-use blocks or format them nicely
+       continue;
+     }
+     
+     // If we have a current section, append content
+     if (currentSection) {
+       // Skip HTML comments
+       if (trimmed.startsWith(&#39;&lt;!--&#39;)) continue;
+       
+       currentSection.content += &#39;\n\n&#39; + trimmed;
+     } else {
+       // Header/intro content
+       sections.push({
+         id: sections.length,
+         type: &#39;other&#39;,
+         content: trimmed,
+       });
+     }
+   }
+   
+   // Don&#39;t forget the last section
+   if (currentSection) sections.push(currentSection);
+   
+   return sections;
+ };
  
  /**
```

```diff
+ /**
+  * Extracts thinking content from a think block
+  */
+ const extractThinkingContent = (thinkBlock) =&gt; {
+   // Format: &lt;think&gt;&lt;details&gt;&lt;summary&gt;Thought Process&lt;/summary&gt;...content...&lt;/details&gt;&lt;/think&gt;
+   // Or just: &lt;think&gt;...content...&lt;/think&gt;
+   let content = thinkBlock
+     .replace(/&lt;think&gt;/g, &#39;&#39;)
+     .replace(/&lt;\/think&gt;/g, &#39;&#39;)
+     .replace(/&lt;details&gt;/g, &#39;&#39;)
+     .replace(/&lt;\/details&gt;/g, &#39;&#39;)
+     .replace(/&lt;summary&gt;.*?&lt;\/summary&gt;/g, &#39;&#39;)
+     .trim();
+   
+   return content;
+ };
+ 
+ /**
+  * Extracts tool use info from a tool-use block
+  */
+ const extractToolUse = (toolBlock) =&gt; {
+   const nameMatch = toolBlock.match(/data-tool-name=&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;/);
+   const summaryMatch = toolBlock.match(/&lt;summary&gt;Tool use: \*\*([^*]+)\*\*[^&lt;]*&lt;\/summary&gt;/);
+   
+   return {
+     name: nameMatch ? nameMatch[1] : &#39;unknown&#39;,
+     summary: summaryMatch ? summaryMatch[1] : &#39;Tool used&#39;,
+   };
+ };
```

```diff
+                         transform: isExpanded ? &#39;rotate(90deg)&#39; : &#39;rotate(0deg)&#39;,
+                         fontSize: &#39;1rem&#39;,
+                         color: &#39;#999&#39;,
+                       }}
+                     &gt;
+                       chevron_right
+                     &lt;/span&gt;
+                     &lt;span
+                       style={{
+                         fontWeight: 400,
+                         fontSize: &#39;0.75rem&#39;,
+                         color: &#39;#999&#39;,
+                         fontFamily: &#39;-apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif&#39;,
+                       }}
+                     &gt;
+                       {isExpanded ? &#39;Collapse&#39; : &#39;Expand&#39;}
+                     &lt;/span&gt;
+                   &lt;/div&gt;
                  &lt;/div&gt;
                  {/* Thinking blocks - displayed as single section with list */}
```

</details>

</tool-use>
